intro: Symphyotrichum turneri, commonly known as Turner's ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as swamps and stream banks. It produces tall, sturdy stems with lance-shaped leaves and clusters of purple to pinkish-purple flowers. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems and a valuable plant for ecological studies.
